author: TheSkiF4er
name: ProdStarterHub - Django REST Service (Python)
shortDescription: A production-ready Django REST template with DRF, Celery scaffolding, Docker, health checks, and best-practice defaults.

ProjectName.description: The Python package name and project folder for the scaffolded service.

Author.description: Author name for template metadata and headers.

Company.description: Company or organization name used in docs and metadata.

IncludeDocker.description: Include production-ready multi-stage Dockerfile and docker-compose for local development.

IncludeKubernetesManifests.description: Include basic Kubernetes manifests and Helm chart scaffold.

IncludeCelery.description: Include Celery scaffolding (worker, beat) and example tasks.

IncludeOpenTelemetry.description: Include OpenTelemetry scaffolding for tracing and metrics.

IncludeGithubActions.description: Include a GitHub Actions workflow for build/test/publish.

IncludeTests.description: Include pytest scaffold and example unit/integration tests.

postActions.description: Create virtual environment and install dependencies (optional).

manualInstructions.text: Create a virtual environment and install dependencies: `python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && pip install -r src/requirements.txt`

postActions.description: Initialize a git repository and make initial commit

manualInstructions.text: Run 'git init && git add . && git commit -m "Initial scaffold from ProdStarterHub Django template"'

args.args: -lc "git init && git add . && git commit -m 'Initial scaffold from ProdStarterHub Django template' || true"

symbolsHelp.description: Customize project generation. Typical usage: copy the template folder and replace placeholders or integrate with your template engine.
usageExamples:
# Copy template folder and rename
cp -R prodstarter_django myservice && cd myservice
# Or use a template engine to replace 'prodstarter_django' with your project name
